oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate Monument at Columbia
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments; Sculpture; Cemeteries; Tombs & sepulchral monuments
Monuments; Soldiers; Cemeteries; Columbia (Tenn.); United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Monument with sculpture of soldier atop marble base at funeral parade rest. He is leaning on his rifle, which is pointed down. Image features sculpture surrounded by tombstones and trees within the cemetery.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee Civil War Centennial Commission
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Confederate monument is located within the Rose Hill Cemetery. The inscription on the base, not visible in this image, is "OUR FALLEN HEROES/1861-1865."
